speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Enter GOWER

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Now sleep y-slaked hath the rout;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: No din but snores the house about,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Made louder by the o'er-fed breast

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Of this most pompous marriage-feast.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The cat, with eyne of burning coal,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Now crouches fore the mouse's hole;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And crickets sing at the oven's mouth,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: E'er the blither for their drouth.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Hymen hath brought the bride to bed.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Where, by the loss of maidenhead,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: A babe is moulded. Be attent,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And time that is so briefly spent

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: With your fine fancies quaintly eche:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: What's dumb in show I'll plain with speech.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: DUMB SHOW.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Enter, PERICLES and SIMONIDES at one door, with  Attendants; a Messenger meets them, kneels, and  gives PERICLES a letter: PERICLES shows it  SIMONIDES; the Lords kneel to him. Then enter  THAISA with child, with LYCHORIDA a nurse. The  KING shows her the letter; she rejoices: she and  PERICLES takes leave of her father, and depart with  LYCHORIDA and their Attendants. Then exeunt SIMONIDES and the rest

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: By many a dern and painful perch

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Of Pericles the careful search,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: By the four opposing coigns

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Which the world together joins,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Is made with all due diligence

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That horse and sail and high expense

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Can stead the quest. At last from Tyre,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Fame answering the most strange inquire,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To the court of King Simonides

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Are letters brought, the tenor these:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Antiochus and his daughter dead;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The men of Tyrus on the head

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Of Helicanus would set on

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The crown of Tyre, but he will none:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The mutiny he there hastes t' oppress;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Says to 'em, if King Pericles

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Come not home in twice six moons,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: He, obedient to their dooms,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Will take the crown. The sum of this,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Brought hither to Pentapolis,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Y-ravished the regions round,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And every one with claps can sound,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: 'Our heir-apparent is a king!

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Who dream'd, who thought of such a thing?'

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Brief, he must hence depart to Tyre:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: His queen with child makes her desire--

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Which who shall cross?--along to go:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Omit we all their dole and woe:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Lychorida, her nurse, she takes,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And so to sea. Their vessel shakes

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: On Neptune's billow; half the flood

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Hath their keel cut: but fortune's mood

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Varies again; the grisly north

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Disgorges such a tempest forth,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That, as a duck for life that dives,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: So up and down the poor ship drives:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The lady shrieks, and well-a-near

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Does fall in travail with her fear:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: And what ensues in this fell storm

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Shall for itself itself perform.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: I nill relate, action may

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Conveniently the rest convey;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Which might not what by me is told.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In your imagination hold

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: This stage the ship, upon whose deck

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The sea-tost Pericles appears to speak.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: SCENE I:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Enter PERICLES, on shipboard

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou god of this great vast, rebuke these surges,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Which wash both heaven and hell; and thou, that hast

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Upon the winds command, bind them in brass,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Having call'd them from the deep! O, still

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thy deafening, dreadful thunders; gently quench

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thy nimble, sulphurous flashes! O, how, Lychorida,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How does my queen? Thou stormest venomously;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Wilt thou spit all thyself? The seaman's whistle

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Is as a whisper in the ears of death,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Unheard. Lychorida!--Lucina, O

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Divinest patroness, and midwife gentle

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To those that cry by night, convey thy deity

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Aboard our dancing boat; make swift the pangs

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Of my queen's travails!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Enter LYCHORIDA, with an Infant

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Now, Lychorida!

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Here is a thing too young for such a place,

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Who, if it had conceit, would die, as I

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Am like to do: take in your arms this piece

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Of your dead queen.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How, how, Lychorida!

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Patience, good sir; do not assist the storm.

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Here's all that is left living of your queen,

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: A little daughter: for the sake of it,

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Be manly, and take comfort.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O you gods!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Why do you make us love your goodly gifts,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And snatch them straight away? We here below

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Recall not what we give, and therein may

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Use honour with you.

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Patience, good sir,

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Even for this charge.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Now, mild may be thy life!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For a more blustrous birth had never babe:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Quiet and gentle thy conditions! for

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou art the rudeliest welcome to this world

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That ever was prince's child. Happy what follows!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thou hast as chiding a nativity

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As fire, air, water, earth, and heaven can make,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To herald thee from the womb: even at the first

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thy loss is more than can thy portage quit,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: With all thou canst find here. Now, the good gods

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Throw their best eyes upon't!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Enter two Sailors

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: What courage, sir? God save you!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Courage enough: I do not fear the flaw;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: It hath done to me the worst. Yet, for the love

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Of this poor infant, this fresh-new sea-farer,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I would it would be quiet.

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: Slack the bolins there! Thou wilt not, wilt thou?

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: Blow, and split thyself.

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: But sea-room, an the brine and cloudy billow kiss

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: the moon, I care not.

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: Sir, your queen must overboard: the sea works high,

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: the wind is loud, and will not lie till the ship be

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: cleared of the dead.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That's your superstition.

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: Pardon us, sir; with us at sea it hath been still

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: observed: and we are strong in custom. Therefore

speaker: First Sailor
text_entry: briefly yield her; for she must overboard straight.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As you think meet. Most wretched queen!

speaker: LYCHORIDA
text_entry: Here she lies, sir.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A terrible childbed hast thou had, my dear;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: No light, no fire: the unfriendly elements

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Forgot thee utterly: nor have I time

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To give thee hallow'd to thy grave, but straight

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Must cast thee, scarcely coffin'd, in the ooze;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Where, for a monument upon thy bones,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And e'er-remaining lamps, the belching whale

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And humming water must o'erwhelm thy corpse,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Lying with simple shells. O Lychorida,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Bid Nestor bring me spices, ink and paper,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My casket and my jewels; and bid Nicander

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Bring me the satin coffer: lay the babe

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Upon the pillow: hie thee, whiles I say

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A priestly farewell to her: suddenly, woman.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exit LYCHORIDA

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: Sir, we have a chest beneath the hatches, caulked

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: and bitumed ready.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I thank thee. Mariner, say what coast is this?

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: We are near Tarsus.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thither, gentle mariner.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Alter thy course for Tyre. When canst thou reach it?

speaker: Second Sailor
text_entry: By break of day, if the wind cease.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O, make for Tarsus!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: There will I visit Cleon, for the babe

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Cannot hold out to Tyrus: there I'll leave it

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: At careful nursing. Go thy ways, good mariner:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I'll bring the body presently.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exeunt
